title: Something Interesting about Lag issues in NA!

embed.description: Album . Why are we losing packets from one serer

body:
Hello,

I am from New Jersey in NA. Recently my ping has gone up from 35 to about 250+ every game I play. So while wondering what was up with my ping I stumbled upon this page: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/spsh1JRU-ping-increase 

I followed the instructions the rioter has given us in the post and have found something interesting that pertains to the lag issue in between the Verizon Fios and the Riot Servers. Here are the results: http://imgur.com/a/iqBfX

From what I see, the riot message is not connecting with one of the servers like it's supposed to and causing the path of the data to be much longer than it should regularly be. Can other people with lag and ping issues from NA also do the test in the other post and post their results to prove that I am not the only one receiving the problems!!!

Thank You, 
Fellow League Player

I'm starting to wonder if some of the servers Riot uses have some of the routing services used by certain ISPS blacklisted and when players are moved to another server they sometimes get hit. After all this happens with no game/website/application other than League of Legends

1.5 Weeks ago I started lagging, not fps, but ping. It doesn't matter if anyone is on my internet or not, I constantly have ping spikes around 200-300, sometimes 500. Before I had this happen I had fine fps (same), but a smooth constant 40ms ping. I don't know why it is acting like this now and I have tried tons of different options to fix my connection probs, but nothing seems to work. I downloaded the program you used, but I don't know what ip adress to test. Otherwise, I would test it. I live in central NA.
And I forgot to add that it seems to only be with this game.
Use the IP address 104.160.131.1 as host on program and start. Let it run for about 5 mins and then post the results!!!
Here were my results (5min): http://imgur.com/a/EMQvb There is packet loss for me. Just to mention, I live in Iowa.
Just did another test after resetting my modem and I got almost exactly what you did! (100% packet loss from 1 host): http://imgur.com/a/AIZs6

Not receiving a response from a host isn't really too concerning, unless it's a giant block.  It looks like your ping is increasing as you countinue to get routed to our servers.  If the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide wasn't able to help, then reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can take a look.  Download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and attach a set of logs to give more context; though, I'm guessing you might have to contact your ISP to investigate those nodes further.  We'll respond to your ticket asap!
Thank you :) I'll see if I get can it fixed within the next few days.
Well then I guess its not just me or Verizon!!!

This issue looks more like a local network problem, as I see packet loss and a poor connection well before leaving your own router.  I suggest using the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help tune up your connection and get you back to a smooth network.  It's important to get that fixed up before assuming your ISP is not routing to our servers properly.  

If the issue is physically with the router, you can try power cycling it.  If that doesn't work, you may need to reach out to your ISP about replacing it.  Hope that helps!

Hello,

I have already had Verizon replace the router a while back and did the hextech repair before running this software. I am still getting this issue and I don't know what else to do. I am also added the stuff to the firewall as you said and etc.

The host with 95% packet loss is probably not a problem on my side, and it would be nice to fix or not have that problem. BUT, on my side, there seems to be some major lag spikes for some reason. Around 400-450ms lag spikes! It would be really nice to know how to fix this. Last test: http://imgur.com/a/2yndc
